['Flee - To run away or escape quickly due to danger or fear.', 'Dash - To move swiftly, often suddenly and unexpectedly.', 'Slip away - Leave quietly and unnoticed from a place or situation.', 'Vanish - Disappear suddenly without any trace.', 'Break off - End an interaction or relationship abruptly.', 'Escape - Freely remove oneself from confinement, danger, or control.', 'Bail out - Leave hurriedly and unexpectedly, especially during a crisis.', 'Disappear - Cease to be visible or noticeable without explanation.', 'Hightail it - Move quickly and with urgency to reach a destination.', 'Skedaddle - Run away suddenly from danger or discomfort.', 'Beat feet - Leave in a hurried manner, often due to avoidance of something negative.', 'Slip the surly bonds - Literally, leaving without permission (from Blind Willie Johnson\'s "Johnson\'s Revelation")', 'Vanish off the face of the earth - To disappear completely.', 'Break away - Leave a situation or relationship suddenly and often with strong emotion.', 'Dash out - Leave quickly and hurriedly, especially in response to an emergency.', 'Hightail it out - Move as fast as possible, usually due to urgent circumstances.', 'Bolt - Run away swiftly or suddenly from a place.', 'Slip the leash - Literally release control (from Blind Willie Johnson\'s "Johnson\'s Revelation")', 'Ebb - To gradually decrease in intensity and fade away, often used metaphorically to describe someone moving away emotionally or physically.', 'Fleece - Literally meaning shearing sheep; figuratively means to deceive or trick (though not directly related to the act of leaving).']
